page.title: 19Bayham Abbey, Lamberhurst
page.content: The building of the{monastery}at{ {Bayham}was begun in 1211 by the premonstratensian canons.It prospered and declined through the centuries until{Cardinal Wolsey}was given charge over the abbey. A mob rioted in protest, reinstated and promised to defend them. The riot was suppressed and the abbey{dissolved}in 1525. The estate within Sussex was sold in 1584 and then in the eighteenth century to the Earl of Camden's family.Since then several imposing residences have been built.The remains of the monastery are administered the Department of the Environment.{Visitors}are able to identify signs of the very early church. Later parts still stand to their full height making a very impressive{ruin}which with lawns, running water and wooded slopes, make a very popular{tourist}attraction.
